column4: I kinda messed up my php.ini file (for php5) and my webserver aint working now, is there a way to get your orginal php.ini file back?
Anyone? *cries* :'(
I kinda messed up my php.ini file (for php5) and my webserver aint working now, is there a way to get your orginal php.ini file back?
remove (with --purge) libapache2-mod-php5 and then reinstall it
problem is that my sources.list aint working, I can't apt-get update - I only get errors, it has worked before
Well, lets address that issue then.  What errors do you get?
tons of errors - the links doesnt seem to work. I googled it up, and others seems to have the same problem
pastebin the errors
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/30755/
and this is my sources.list -- http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/30756/
Ah.  You're using breezy.  Try switching back to the ubuntu repos, although I don't know if breezy repos are up anymore.  Breezy EOL was a few months ago
you really ought to upgrade
Erm, you also shouldn't have those hoary errors.  Especially since they're not in your sources.list, you must have those in some other place.
but, that's the reason you can't upgrade any, because I don't think those repos are open anymore

I'm not sure it's going to be possible.  Check your package cache (/var/cache/apt/ and see if libapache2-mod-php5 is in there.  Although, oddly enough, I can't figure out which package contains it (even though I have it on my system right now)
check /usr/share/php5/ there might be a copy of it there
actually yes, I think that's where it comes from, which is why it's not in the dpkg cache.  That file should be what you're looking for
You really should schedule some downtime and upgrade to dapper though.  I took the plunge in february, since I didn't want to cut it too close.
It's just a dev server anyways, I'm gonna run debian sarge in the future -- and I cannot access this server if it crashes, I can but I don't want to (kinda hard to explain the situtation im in)
You can't apt-get anything because the repos for 5.10 (which is breezy, hoary is 5.04) don't exist anymore.
well, dapper isnt working well with game-servers.
Mind joining a channel so we can chat for a sec? I'm geting confused by all the text in here
sure, join #ubuntu-classroom
